div.p: DISREGARD what one SHOULD NOT DISREGARD.
1. The general word for neglecting something, either by deliberately ignoring it or by a failure to take due care, is hū 忽 (ant. jǐn 謹 "pay careful attention to").
2. Lè 略 is a deliberate act of neglecting something one has a duty to pay attention to.

3. Màn 慢 (ant. jìng 敬 "pay proper and respectful attention to") and jiǎn 簡 (ant. xì 細 "pay detailed attention to") refer to a typically deliberate and defiant, often a deliberately outrageous, failure to pay proper attention to what is expected to be heeded.
4. Shū 疏 (ant. yán 嚴 "pay strict attention to") refers to inadvertent nonchalant neglectfulness.

NB: Yí 遺 "leave out" and shì 釋 "leave aside for the time being" refer to a deliberate but possibly defensible failure to take note of something, and these words are thus naturally treated in this meaning under the heading DISREGARD.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: Anthologia sive Florilegium rerum et materiarum selectarum

sense.def: unperturbed; indifferently
overlook, fail to take proper note of
overlook, lose sight of; fail to notice; fail to use; fail to take proper note of
be wrongfully neglected; be wrongfully set aside
neglect to V as one should
fail to act in accordance with; fail to live up to
neglectfully cease to be mindful of; neglectfully forget about V-ing
cease to be mindful of; fail to be diligent with respect to; fail to take proper account of (opp. 顧, as in 識記: 顧小而忘大,後必有害

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

entry.def: The general word for neglecting something, either by deliberately ignoring it or by a failure to take due care, is hū 忽 (ant. jǐn 謹 "pay careful attention to").

sense.def: not paying proper attention > be spaced out, be mentally absent
pay no proper attention to 忽於
be neglected 可忽
be negligent in the care of oneself
(of duties:) be carried out in a lax way; (of persons)be negligent, be lax; be negligent
fail to pay sufficient attention to (Danish: se stort på)
carry out in a lax way; neglect; be lax about
negligence
be careless; negligent
careless; free; idle
do without, make no use of; forget all about
no matter how V1
to VERB disregarding N; to VERB irrespective of N
neglect, fail to live up to

entry.def: Lyè 略 is a deliberate act of neglecting something one has a duty to pay attention to.

sense.def: neglecting detail> roughly
be negligent
be slipshod with, not go into detail about
the remiss

entry.def: Shū 疏 (ant. yán 嚴 "pay strict attention to") refers to inadvertent nonchalant neglectfulness.

sense.def: negligence; instance of negligence
neglectful> be thoughtless, careless; not detailed; roughshod
be sloppy with respect to

entry.def: Màn 慢 (ant. jìng 敬 "pay proper and respectful attention to") and jiǎn 簡 (ant. xì 細 "pay detailed attention to") refer to a typically deliberate and defiant, often a deliberately outrageous, failure to pay proper attention to what is expected to be heeded.

sense.def: neglecting detail: concisely, briefly
be neglectful; be slipshod, unattentive, rough and ready, without polite attention to detail
negligently; shoddily
treat shabbily; treat with little respect, be arrogant towards; slight (another person)
be slipshod about, be negligent with; leave aside, pay no attention to; be unceremonious and negligent about, fail to pay proper attention to
SHI: be remiss
stride across, be able to disregard
overlook, fail to pay proper attention to
neglect, bypass, leave out; ignore
neglect something; forget to do something
neglected; ignored; disregarded
disregard; neglect; make light of; ignore (a threat)
(dirty>) be negligent (GONG)
be neglectful with regard to

bibl.title: 唐五代語言詞典 Táng Wǔdài yǔyán cídiǎn A Dictionary of the Language of the Tang and Five Dynasties Periods

note.p: Glossed by Jiang/Cao: 310 in the following way: (1) pi2ngcha2ng 平常 'be regular, normal, ordinary'; (2) ca3oshua1i 草摔; sui2-bia4n 隨便 ' be casual; as one pleases'; (3) we2ina2n 為難. 'create difficulties; be in an awkward situation'.

sense.def: carelessly, in a negligent way, casually

bibl.title: 唐五代語言詞典 Táng Wǔdài yǔyán cídiǎn A Dictionary of the Language of the Tang and Five Dynasties Periods

sense.def: Tang: be negligent, inattentive, not careful
neglect so as to lose the contextually determinate thing
neglect so as to lose
neglectfully
not care
disregard!
blind negligence of what is important

bibl.title: 唐五代語言詞典 Táng Wǔdài yǔyán cídiǎn A Dictionary of the Language of the Tang and Five Dynasties Periods

note.p: 'to be careless; to relax; to take it easy' and implies that one does not put enough effort into a matter. In other texts from the Tang period it can also have the meaning 'behaviour; conduct; words and deeds' (za4o-ci4 造次 (N); YOUXIANKU) and ocasionally it is used adverbally: 'quickly; in a hurry' (za4o-ci4 造次 (ADV)).

sense.def: be careless, negligent, to take it easy (not fullfilling one's duties)

bibl.title: 唐五代語言詞典 Táng Wǔdài yǔyán cídiǎn A Dictionary of the Language of the Tang and Five Dynasties Periods

forget about one's promises; fail to keep word
ZUO: neglect as unimportant
neglect, disregard; suppress
negligent, lax (= 紓)
become remiss for any moment
be negligent
be negligent in one's duties
(probably = gu3man4 盬慢:) be careless, be sloppy
refuse to pay attention to, turn one's back to
(= man4 慢) overlook, neglect
omitted N, disregarded N; left out N

(consider unworthy >) overlook
lag behind due to neglect
fail to cover anything, leave out anything, fail to deal properly with anything
